sections.title: Rewrite Your Money Story
sections.subtitle: Discover how subconscious beliefs drive every financial decision

sections.title: In This Lesson
items: Reveal hidden messages you absorbed about money
Understand how identity shapes spending and saving
Learn techniques for reprogramming limiting beliefs
Create new affirmations that support your goals

sections.title: Your Money Origin Story
sections.content: Our earliest experiences with money become scripts that run in the background. If you heard phrases like 'money doesn't grow on trees,' you may associate wealth with greed or scarcity. Recognizing these inherited narratives is the first step to changing them.

points.title: Scarcity Programming
points.description: Believing there will never be enough can trigger hoarding or overspending when money appears.

points.title: Success Guilt
points.description: Feeling bad about earning more than family or friends leads to self-sabotage.

points.title: Fear of Responsibility
points.description: Worrying about managing larger sums keeps you at the same income level.

sections.title: Mindset Shift
sections.content: Beliefs are practiced thoughts. Choose ones that serve your future, not just repeat your past.

sections.title: Rewire the Narrative
sections.content: Use cognitive reframing to challenge the old story. When you catch yourself thinking 'I'm bad with money,' replace it with 'I'm learning a new skill every day.' Reinforce the new belief with evidence, like paying a bill on time or contributing to savings.

sections.title: Belief Reset Practice
steps: List three money beliefs you heard growing up and note how they show up today.
Underline the beliefs that limit you. Write a new empowering statement for each.
Record the reframed statements as voice memos and listen daily for seven days.
Collect proof of progress (receipts, screenshots, journal entries) to reinforce the new mindset.
Share your reframed beliefs with an accountability partner or coach for support.
